answers.text:
Winchester, VA has a Parking Authority. There is a staff director and small staff for maintenance, permits, and enforcement. Citizen board includes a former councilor and a planning commission liaison. The authority recently completed a big project to automate the garage gate/payment system.
Info: http://www.winchesterva.gov/parking/index.php
Sam Anderson is a good resource on it.

answers.author: John Zakian
answers.text:
I have experience in two cities with different structures, Yonkers, NY and West Palm Beach, FL.  Yonkers has an independent, self-sustaining parking authority with the ability to set its own rates, acquire and operate off street facilities, plus has some regulatory power over city for installing on street parking meters.  West Palm Beach has a Parking Administration which is part of the city government and has both on street parking meters and off street parking structures and lots.  Both have strengths and weaknesses and it really ultimately depends on what the local government wants to accomplish with public parking.

Call Maxie Brown at the Town of Culpeper, VA (540) 829-8260.  They have a good Parking Authority and the documents that establish their scope of work, charter, etc.  They also lease out spaces and have had a successful, long-term program.  You can also speak with Becky Smyth 706-236-4458, she is the parking manager for the City of Rome, GA.

Contact City of Beverly Hills who has approximately 6,000 city owned and operated public parking spaces.  they do not have a parking authority but have suffered ballot measures that have forced them to charge parking rates well below the costs of operation thus impacting their General Fund.  Some good lesson here in public owed space.

author: Amanda Paez
text:
Does anyone have information the establishment/operation of a parking authority? Our City is looking at using a commission to oversee parking in our downtown area.  Any information on structure/management, issues, comments, or sample documents are apprciated. 
In addition to regulating parkings, one possibility we are looking into is leasing private lots to open up to public use. If anyone has experience with this, comments would be appreciated.
